question_text: An enterprise IT department is developing laptop troubleshooting protocols for a mixed-vendor environment. Which considerations are most critical for success? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Training staff on form factor limitations for each model
Understanding precise specification requirements per brand
Using identical tools for all laptop models
Implementing universal repair timelines regardless of complexity
correct_answer: Training staff on form factor limitations for each model
Understanding precise specification requirements per brand
explanation: Success in a mixed-vendor environment requires comprehensive understanding of each manufacturer's serviceability approach, form factor constraints, and specification requirements to ensure effective and safe troubleshooting.
